intro: Achras zapota var. candollei, commonly known as the chicle tree, is a tropical plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a member of the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and smooth, green bark. The tree produces a latex sap that has historically been used to make chewing gum. Its fruit is a spiny, green drupe that contains a single, hard seed. This species is valued for its ecological role and has been studied for its potential in sustainable agriculture and medicinal applications.
